headline: Copycat KFC Mashed Potatoes
description: If you have a craving for KFC's mashed potatoes, try this copycat recipe.
name: Copycat KFC Mashed Potatoes
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Cover potatoes with cold water by 1 inch in a large saucepan. Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil until potatoes are fork-tender but still hold their shape, about 10 minutes; drain.

Return potatoes to saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until excess liquid has evaporated and potatoes are dry, about 1 minute. Process hot potatoes through a potato ricer into a large bowl.

Meanwhile, heat half-and-half and butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until warmed and butter is melted, about 3 minutes; gradually pour into riced potatoes. Stir to incorporate; season with pepper and remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Garnish with parsley.

review.reviewBody: I’ve never been impressed with KFC’s mashed potatoes, but these potatoes are really good. Probably better than KFC. I used a mixer since I didn’t have a potato ricer.
Easy to make and I wouldn't change a thing!

It has been such a long time since I’ve eaten anything from KFC. This recipe’s ingredients are pretty much what I typically use, although I’ll also add some sour cream or softened cream cheese if it’s in the fridge. So I can’t really say if these mashed potatoes measure up to KFC’s. The only thing I can say is that these are some pretty tasty mashed potatoes. They taste good, and the consistency is spot on.

Butter , milk, potatoes, salt, I mean that is pretty much the standard mashed potato recipe, why does this have to be specifically KFC mashed potatoes? It's not like other mashed potato recipes call for mustard or sweet pickle relish, the above recipe is pretty much it.
To make KFC mashed potatoes, you only need instant potato powder and water (and even that would be an improvement).

KFC uses instant mashed potatoes (IMP), so why wouldn't you? 2 cups IMP flakes, 2 cups water, 1 cup milk, 3 T butter, dash of salt. Combine liquids in microwaveable bowl, mix in flakes and salt, turn with a fork until well-moistened mass. Microwave 5 minutes loosely covered. Stir in butter, add pepper if you like. Done. 6 servings in less time than peeling and cutting potatoes.

This recipe was good but make it great by adding onion to the boiling water and by adding garlic and red pepper flakes to the half and half and butter mixture. Then go crazy and add diced red bell pepper and chopped scallion to the parsley that you use as the garnish (in equal parts). KFC will envy you and your version of their mashed potatoes! (and do not even think about adding crumbled cooked bacon to this recipe!) LOL!
